result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan B Ferra was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight time.  Sentence credit of 53 days were
granted if imposed.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: To be paid for Roundy's Corporation - to be paid joint and several as a condition of probation.  Restitution to be paid before costs and fines.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended. Comply with random urine screens. Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.  No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Any valid prescriptions drugs must be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  No contact with any Pick N Save or co-defendant Michael Hoening. DNA Sample to be provided if not yet previously done. 
 If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Huber, non working hours, sentence to commence FORTHWITH.

vacating bail forfeiture signed by Judge Aprahamian on 5/24/16.

Defendant Nathan B Ferra in court, in custody, with attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.   Attorney Haines appeared for the County of Waukesha.  The Court calls the matter to address the motion to vacate the bail forfeitures on 15CF953 and 15CF1152. Attorney Haines objects to any modification of the forfeiture.  The Court reinstates the $1500.00 surety bond on 15CF1152 and reinstates $1500.00 cash on 15CF953 and it is to be refunded to the poster.  $1500.00 cash on 15CF1152 remains forfeited.
